title: Sejuani is relevant for sixteen seconds, nerfed.
body:
Lee Sin dominates the jungle for three years and permanently warps the metagame, a-ok.

 Thanks for continuing to make your priorities clear, Riot. Maybe if you'd just give Sejuani more mobility you can stop nerfing her so much. Because champs pay nothing for mobility and actually tend to be stronger than those without it anyway. Because balance!

 "But it's just the PBE" The last time a meaningful change turned up on the PBE and got reverted was WAIT FOR IT

 LEE FUCKING SIN

 AND THE CROWD GOES WILD

BECAUSE THAT'S THE ONLY PRIORITY RIOT UNDERSTANDS

 edit the first: It's good to see most of the BUT MUH WINRATE idiots being downvoted into oblivion. Keep up the good work, people whose public education systems did not utterly fail them.

 edit the second: I replied a couple of times to a few of the less belligerent responses with a message that I will summarize thusly. Whether or not the Sej nerfs are justified or even fair is not the point. The point is, some champions get brought back in line immediately at the first hint of trouble and some are allowed to run free. Any team that purports to have "balance" as one of its goals cannot be playing favorites, but Riot has proven time and again that favorites are how they are operating. (Compare Lee Sin's impact on the game with Sona's and you'll see my point. OH NO SHE SANG AT ME FOR >0% DAMAGE)

 To the imaginary Riot balance team member who will respond to this saying "we don't balance based on favorites": Yes you do. You can say you don't all you like. You do. We laughed when Morello said they don't hate supports and we will laugh if you bother to show your face here at all (you won't). That you want to nerf Sej is not the problem. The problem is all the other game-warping champions you let run free to do as they please. 

 edit the third: READ EDIT THE SECOND GUYS, SOME OF YOU HAVE MISSED IT
 ~Uiru

The point isn't the numbers, the point is that Riot plays favorites with who gets nerfed and under what what criteria those nerfs "need to happen".

OP is right, Lee Sin HAS dominated the jungle for 3 years, with *very* short windows (I'm talking like 1-maybe-2-patches-long windows) of being perhaps a 2nd tier pick rather than top tier pick that's good on *any* team, and *very obviously* warps the jungle metagame with a kit that makes **literally zero** meaningful trade-offs in *any* area with regards to "what you want a jungler to be able to do".

Meanwhile, no nerfs for Lee Sin and *the only champion in LoL history to have his **needed** rework cancelled purely because his "mains" whined enough,* and that is proof of favoritism plainly viewable by *anyone*. Regardless of how you feel about his balance state or the (honestly, *not* rationally debatable) overloaded state of his kit, you *cannot* deny Riot's favoritism for the champion.

Sejuani is overpowered with the introduction of the new item, that is to be sure. But that's not the issue. The issue is the ***instant*** Sejuani goes from "strong" to "overpowered", Riot nerfs her, while Lee Sin has ***three fucking years*** of being a top pick and blatantly going against *everything* Riot claims as a design paradigm for their jungle and yet get ***no*** real hits to his power or versatility, ever.

The point OP is making really has nothing to do with "Sejuani got nerfed too hard", it's the fact that because Riot has such ***ridiculously*** obvious favoritism when it comes to the jungle, every *other* jungler gets *instantly* changed as soon as they're a *little* too powerful, ***except for Lee Sin,*** who is allowed to be a dominating pick that *by Riot's own definition* not only has an *incredibly* flawed design but also goes against *literally everything Riot has ever said about how the jungle should function*.

It is just a love tap to her early clear, and will leave a good Sejuani player just where they should be. Her issue was that a ton of players were picking her up (her pick rate nearly tripled) and doing just fine with her. This will be more of a "separate the good from the great" kind of balance change, not anything devastating like people are complaining about.

P.S. I would also laugh so hard if they finally have Lee nerfs this patch cycle, it would shut up the whiners for at least a week.

Yeah, it would shut them up for the week he remains nerfed, until Riot comes out and says, "Well, there was too much backlash about the Lee Sin nerfs, so we reverted them."  Thus proving the point that they play favorites.  I know this because it already happened, despite the fact that there was much much less Lee Sin nerf backlash than Veigar, Sona, or even Sejuani here.

The problem is not that Riot is responding to a dominant champion quickly.

Anybody who played Sejuani before Cinderhulk knows she was going to be top-tier when it released.

The problem is that Riot is showing that they CAN respond to a dominant champion quickly. 

If Sejuani is getting nerfed immediately but Lee Sin is not, that means they are consciously choosing not to touch Lee Sin, who has been dominant nearly ever since his release.

That said, I agree that these are very light changes.

The fact that they're nerfing her *at all* is ludicrous. Not the degree that she's being nerfed: The fact that the balance team went "Man, this champ is on an upswing, we can't have that!" and immediately dropped the hammer while champions like Lee, Zed, and Nid are complained about by an enormous chunk of the community on a daily basis and nothing is being done about it.

Action was taken because, while Lee is picked twice as often as Sejuani, he has 46% win rate (bottom 10), while Sejuani has 57% (top 1).

Winrates are not a measure of champ strength.  If anything, pick rates are a better indicator, because people play what they think will win.  Lee Sin's high pick rate shows that the VAST majority of the community understands that he wins games, even if they don't understand HOW he wins well enough to actually succeed when playing him.

Champions with lower pick rates will have naturally higher win rates, because the only people playing them are those DEDICATED to that champion.  You should always look at lower pick rate champions as being about 10% lower than the stats say they are.  Or look at them as 5% lower and the massively popular champions at 5% higher.

Riot should at least wait a patch or two and let people actually learn how to play against her before nerfing her back to the bottom 10 picked champions. The way Riot knee jerk balances shit just reeks of amateur design. I can't remember a time when Blizzard alternatively nerfed and buffed the same thing in over and over again in the course of 6 patches. If something is considered strong in StarCraft, they didn't just gut it immediately, and go figure, strategies always emerge to counter play.
Obviously, this proves Rito is supporting Ashe or Lissandra for the throne of the Freljord.

She's been strong ever since her changes in 4.21.  It just so happens that those changes didn't put her directly into the spotlight.  Thus her play rate remained lower.  After 5.5 her play rate increased dramatically after just like, 3 days (because Cinderhulk happens to make her an entirely different beast as the game progresses).  Those PBE changes won't gut her by a long-shot, but it is impossible to deny she is strong right now.

About Lee Sin, I understand the dread that we all share about him.  The simple thing though is that it will likely take a rework to remove him from the top of the food chain, and even then he doesn't dominate solo queue that hard.  The only place Lee is really a problem is up in higher ELOs and professional play where people know him inside and out.  He happens to be strong due to being a generalist.  

Once they rework him they can keep the generalist, but he SHOULD have weaknesses.  A generalist that has weakness(es)?  Ezreal.  Ezreal lacks waveclear, all of his abilities are skill-shots, and he has one mobility spell.  On the flip side, he is never really irrelevant throughout the game (provided he isn't falling behind) and has strengths he can play to (Global Ult, strong poke, CDR via his Q).

edit: Also worth noting, if these nerfs do happen to impact Sejuani enough that people stop playing her as much they'll probably just flock to Amumu who plays very similarly.

No, Lee Sin does not need a rework.  He is supposed to be an early game pressure jungler.  So why then does he have 200% bonus AD scaling on his ult and EXECUTE damage on his Q?  Those are late game scaling beast numbers.  All he needs is a SERIOUS nerf to his scaling, rather than the pathetic slap on the wrist "can no longer apply the shield to a ward.. but he can still jump to them" Riot gave him last time.

By rework I didn't necessarily mean new skills and crap.  But more like a gameplay update, like what they did with Viktor.  Switch around some of his power but preserve his identity.  Right now he scales super hard and if he doesn't build damage past Warrior or Warrior + Hydra he still puts out considerable damage later in the game.  It should be more like he goes from high damage early game to focus on his utility later.  Currently he has high damage early, but due to his high base damages, scaling, and execute on Q his damage does not fall off as hard as it should (though, that isn't to say he should be punished for building more AD than he currently does).

He also has some really unnecessary things in his kit (like true vision on Q and E, should just be normal vision).  His energy costs are also not very meaningful.  Just rearranging his power while keeping the basis of his kit intact (high mobility, damage on Q2 increases as enemy health drops, long-distance knockback on Ult) would serve him and the game better.

Generally, when a champion becomes an outlier in terms of strength (outlier means >55% win rate, by quite a margin), then this champion is definitely a little too strong. It doesn't matter how weak this champion was before, how popular he was, what criteria or role this champion performs, or how popular or strong other champions are. Thank Riot there is jungle diversity now, and this nerf won't ruin it in any way. Sejuani will still be a very strong pick.
